TopicTitle: Signs You're In for a Short Flight

Articles.Content: When you forgot to install KER.

1 hour ago, RandomUser said:

Fair enough.  To me it was a little more strange cause it was a shuttle strapped to a rocket, which I didn't think would work let alone on the first try (not exactly, I did the staging wrong the two previous attempts) but you got a point.

The American space program spent 20 years acclimating us to this weirdness

You land perfectly on Tylo or Laythe with more than enough dV to make it back to your Jool5 mothership, EVA happily and plant a flag. You then notice a distinct lack of mobility enhancers in your design.

You plan to build something elaborate with KAS/KIS and realize you don't have enough kerbal to move the heavy parts. Or you made sure you could move all the parts just fine and go to attach something and you have Bob instead of Bill...

When you're halfway through your fuel at 300m

On your Mun rocket
When your Sepatrons ignite in your first stage and you don't notice until decoupling when your booster scrapes your main tank away.

When you have to enable SAS to prevent your rocket from inching itself off the launch pad.

When SAS converts this slow, random jittering into a gradually increasing hula dance.

Edited July 8, 2016 by Corona688
When bits of solar panel flutter away with your discarded fairing because you were trying to keep your fairing as small as possible.
Your spaceplane achieves a world record for 10 meters underwater.

When you're half-way to LKO and something...something...explodes with a very loud bang, but everything keeps cruising along like nothing happened.

 

For now.

 

-Jn-

When you land on the dark side of Ike and timewarp, waiting for a sunrise.

(Actually, more of a long, long, long flight.)
When you decide to be all 'fancy' and use something besides 'stability assist' during a gravity turn...  And hit retrograde instead of prograde.
When you try and shift-zoom for a closer look during a delicate docking maneuver.
Your rocket is pointed 10 degrees above prograde and you are stil losing altitude.
When physwarp starts your craft sliding downhill
When your ready to go, hit the space bar and.........the launch clamps let go but the engines remain silent.......
When the 'yaw' indicator is half-pinned, while landed.

When you throttle up for a planned maneuver and the delta-V counter goes up instead of down.

When you realize your carefully-planned maneuver takes a shortcut through the inside of the moon.
Prelude to a Short Flight.
You touch down before your boosters do.

On 7/6/2016 at 6:20 PM, ag3nt108 said:

You take the launch clamps with you

I didn't know it this was possible...

When you get just a little too aggressive with that gravity turn and it becomes more of a swan dive

When you hit the staging button just a quarter of a second too soon and your asparagus boosters instantly obliterate everything above them, leaving Jebediah inexplicably still grinning as his capsule tumbles out of control.
When your two mainsail engines suddenly go "freelancer" and rip your space craft apart, taking the 4 orange fuel tanks with them.
When you land on Eve

You build a massive rocket to send Jeb to EVE and once its gone, find him in the Kerbalnaut Complex .... smiling....

You send a probe to Duna and it lands on the Mun.

Edited July 11, 2016 by kiwi1960
